tn.text: Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.
Moses wanted everyone in Israel to hear and obey his words, but his voice was probably not so loud that everyone actually heard him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: that I will speak in your ears today
tn.text: Here "ears" refers to the whole person. This metaphor emphasizes that the people know what Moses has said to them, so they cannot sin and then say they did not know they were sinning. AT: "that I will speak to you today" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Yahweh did not make this covenant with our ancestors
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) Yahweh did not only make a covenant with those who were at Horeb; the covenant was also with the later generations of Israelites or 2) Yahweh did not make this covenant with their distant ancestors, such as, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; instead, this covenant began with the Israelites at Horeb.
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.
Use your language's idiom for two people who are close to each other and looking at each other when they are speaking to each other. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"on the mountain"
Moses is referring to an event that happened about 40 years earlier.

tn.ref: out of the house of slavery
tn.text: Here the metonym "house of slavery" refers to Egypt where the people of Israel had been slaves. AT: "out of the place where you were slaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Moses continues reminding the people what Yahweh has commanded them. The phrases "you will" and "you will not" are commands. He speaks to the Israelites as if they were one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: You will have no other gods before me
tn.text: "You must not worship any other gods but me"

tn.ref: that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water below
tn.text: This can be made more explicit. AT: "that is in the earth beneath your feet, or that is in the water below the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: You will not bow down to them or serve them
tn.text: "You will not worship the carved figures or do as they command"
"Never"
"I ... want you to worship only me"

tn.ref: to thousands, to those who love me
tn.text: Some translations read "to a thousand generations of those who love me." The word "thousands" is a metonym or hyperbole for a number too many to count. AT: "to thousands of people, to those who love me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: You will not take the name of Yahweh
tn.text: "You will not use the name of Yahweh"
Translate this as it is in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:05:09|5:09]].
"carelessly" or "without proper respect" or "for wrong purposes"

tn.ref: Yahweh will not hold him guiltless
tn.text: This can be stated in a positive form. AT: "Yahweh will consider him guilty" or "Yahweh will punish him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"to dedicate it to God"
"do all your usual duties"
"7th day." Here "seventh" is the ordinal number for seven. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: On it you will not do
tn.text: "On that day never do"
Here "gates" is a reference to the city itself. AT: "within your community" or "inside your city" or "living with you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is an idiom. AT: "You must remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: by a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm
tn.text: Here "a mighty hand" and "an outstretched arm" are metaphors for Yahweh's power. Translate this as it is in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:34|4:34]]. AT: "by showing his mighty power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Translate this as it is in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:05:09|5:09]].
"You will not sleep with anyone other than your spouse"

tn.ref: You will not give false witness against your neighbor
tn.text: "You will not tell lies about someone"
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Translate this as it is in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:05:09|5:09]].
Moses continues to remind the people of Israel what Yahweh said.
Moses continues to remind the people of Israel what happened in the past.

The word "voice" is a metonym for the sound of the voice or for the person who was speaking. AT: "heard the sound of the voice" or "heard Yahweh speaking" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Moses continues to remind the Israelites what the Israelites had said to Moses.
They were afraid that they would die if Yahweh spoke to them. This question can be translated as a statement. AT: "We are afraid that we will die." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: For who besides us is there ... have done?
tn.text: This question can be translated as a statement. AT: "There are no other people besides us ... have done." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
This is a metonym for "all people" or "all living beings." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "me" refers to Moses.
If your language has an idiom that expresses a strong desire for something, you might want to use it here. AT: "I would be very happy if there were" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Yahweh continues speaking to Moses.
"you will teach the people of Israel"
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.
Moses is giving a command to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: you will not turn aside to the right hand or to the left
tn.text: This compares a person disobeying God to a person turning off of the correct path. AT: "you will not disobey him in any way" or "you will do everything he says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Long days are a metaphor for a long life. Translate this as it is in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:39|4:40]]. AT: "be able to live a long time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
